title: name of tab after session restore
content: when i restore session after a crash, the first tab get name "session restore" instead of the actual title of the tab. is there a way to get the correct title?

title: My profile bookmarks and password not imported
content:
So, when I switched to my new laptop few months ago after installing Firefox (Ubuntu 22.04) all my bookmarks and passwords were imported well. I just had to login to FF. Then, once again I re-installed Firefox and again managed to get all passwords and bookmarks.

Today I again re-installed FF (have some strange crashes) and after installing it and logging in bookmarks and passwords are not re-imported?!? Logged in to pocked and it works well, but FF bookmarks and passwords are just not there. It syncs, but not finding them.

Also, my settings, like my previously installed plugins are not imported at all. Just like I'm synchronizing with completely new profile.

I don't have multiple profiles.

I'm using FF as my primary browser (web developer) and both are very important to me. Please help me retrieving them back.
creator: golubovicm

title: Website does not completely load when in full screen
content:
I am using a 16-inch 2021 MacBook Pro with a M1 Pro processor. Firefox 108.0.1.

This website https://www.urbanoutfitters.com/shop/uo-large-houndstooth-shirt?category=sale&color=032&type=REGULAR&quantity=1 (and all other Urban Outfitter pages) does not load any of the images and buttons for me when I have the browser window at a large size. If I shrink the Firefox window and refresh, the page will load normally and I can make the window big again to continue browsing.

Can anyone reproduce this? I have tried all steps listed here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-cant-load-websites-other-browsers-can and nothing works.

The website loads fine in Chrome in fullscreen.

title: viewing, saving, and deleting cookies
content:
This is just a complaint . . . Settings>Cookies and Site Data>Manage Data does not show the server that set a cookie, it only shows the domain -- e.g. domain.com, not https://www.domain.com or even www.domain.com However, Settings>Cookies and Site Data>Manage Exceptions requires the complete server name. If I don't include "https://" or "http://" it adds them. This makes it difficult or impossible to actually manage exceptions; I can't specify which cookie(s) I want to allow, block, or save if I can't see the data that's stored.

Why can't I choose a domain in Manage Data and get a Manage Exceptions pop-up?
creator: whatsit1

title: Safesearch Google attivo e bloccato
content: Il safesearch di Google risulta attivo e bloccato da un amministratore (che sono io). Nelle impostazioni risulta che "il browser è gestito dalla propria azienda", ma è il browser del mio desktop personale. Come posso risolvere?
creator: alessandro.olivetto

title: Autoplay in Youtube starts then after half second or second stops.
content:
Youtube autoplay stopped to work properly.

After previous video next video really starts automatically then, may be after half a second or second, the video stops and returns to intro splash screen of the video. One must press Play to start this next video again. I tried next steps: 1. In Firefox Privacy and security settings / Autoplay: I allowed audio and video autoplay for all sites 2. On the left side of URL string for Youtube site I pressed the button and also allowed audio and video autoplay for the site. The image on this button changed. I reloaded Youtube - no effect, reloaded Firefox and Youtube - all the same.

3. I checked Youtube autoplay in Microsoft Edge browser - it works correctly.

What should be done in Firefox to restore autoplay? I don't remember when this problem appeared.
creator: bvn123

title: Context menu issue
content:
I have just installed Firefox onto my Apple iMac running the Ventura OS.

I have imported bookmarks from other browsers into Firefox.

My issue is when I select "bookmarks" from the toolbar and the drop down opens. Once open and I make a selection on a site, upon using the right click context menu to select "open in new tab," that context menu is mostly behind the bookmarks drop down menu. Therefore, I'm unable to "open in a new tab" or pretty much anything else.

Oddly, this only happens when in full screen mode. If not in full screen mode, the context menu opens properly in front of the book marks drop down.

I have uploaded an image showing what I have tried to describe.

Has anyone else encountered this issue? Any suggestions?

Thank you in advance, Dave
creator: dmcvey2611

title: Ebay: exclamation mark on the lock icon to the left of the address bar says connection not secure
content:
Using Firefox v108 Win10.

When I do a search on eBay I get a search result page. Everything is fine.

The problem is, when I click on an item to get details, the address bar shows an exclamation mark on the lock icon. The message says, "Connection not secure. Parts of this page are not secure (like images)." It continues to say, your connection to this site is not private. Information you submit could be viewed y others (like passwords, messages, credit cards, etc.) "Your connection is not private and information you share with the site could be viewed by others."

No way am I using eBay like this. Date and time are good, cleared cache and restarted numerous times, rebooted modem/router couple times and ran cCleaner. The home page and search pages are ok. The problem is when I click on an item to get details.

Microsoft Edge works fine. I don't get the exclamation mark on the lock icon or the security message when using Edge. Called eBay and they said everything is ok but put in a work order... been months and never heard back from them. Comments/suggestions?
creator: scottnell

title: Come disattivare i processi multipli di firefox
content:
Buongiorno, quando apro firefox si aprono 6 processi (task manager). Seguendo le indicazioni del forum ho provato a disattivare nelle prestazioni "Utilizza le impostazioni predefinite" ma non compare l'opzione per poter disattivare i processi multipli. Il mio PC utilizza windows 7 ultimate service pack 1 a 32 bit e la versione di firefox è 108.0.1 Ho provato anche a inserire una nuova variabile d'ambiente utente MOZ_FORCE_DISABLE_E10S con valore della variabile uguale a 1, ma senza risultato. Per certezza ho riavviato il PC ma sempre uguale. Vi sarei grato se riusciste a darmi una mano. Grazie in anticipo. 

            Stefano
creator: stefanomarche58

title: Browser gets stuck and, can't open sites in new tabs, can't save pages from the current tabs.
content:
Sometimes, unpredictably, the browser stops working in a way that the page stops working, and trying to reload the page, open a new tab, or even save the content on a page, simply doesn't work. The singlefile extension fails, and I can't just disable it, and re-enable it, the browser won't let me do that, either. The browser's built-in save function won't even progress to completion. That is inconvenient when I'm trying to save chat, or some other ephemeral thing, that won't be available after restarting the browser. I don't want this to happen anymore. I don't want this situation to recur. I'm not sure what to do to prevent it in the future. I'm not sure what causes this mess. I don't know what else to say about it. Please tell me what I'm doing wrong, and how to fix this?

The browser seemed to be in the throes a crash, but it just wouldn't finish itself off. So I killed the main process, which I thought should trigger a crash report, but it didn't.

content: I think this started after my most recent upgrade - I'm currently on 108.0.1, but I suspect it was an upgrade from 107, not just from 108.0 (I use PortableApps and only upgrade through PA, and it takes time for PA to prep new versions of app, so sometimes short-lived versions are skipped, and the 108.0.1 changelog only mentions one tiny bug fix).
